aps.h File Reference

The header file describes the public APS interface and APS types. More...

#include <configServer.h>
#include <types.h>
#include <nwk.h>
#include <appFramework.h>
#include <macAddr.h>

 Parameters structure of the APS_BindConf() function. ZigBee spec r17: Table 2.7, page 36: The APSME-BIND.confirm primitive. This primitive allows the next higher layer to be notified of the results of its request to bind two devices together, or to bind a device to a group. More...
struct  APS_BindReq_t
 ZigBee spec r17: Table 2.6, page 34: Parameters structure of the APS_BindReq() function. Binding allows the next higher layer to request to bind two devices together, or to bind a device to a group, by creating an entry in its local binding table, if supported. More...
struct  APS_UnbindConf_t
 Parameters structure of the APS_UnbindConf() function. ZigBee spec r17: Table 2.9, page 34: The APSME-UNBIND.confirm primitive. This primitive allows the next higher layer to be notified of the results of its request to unbind two devices, or to unbind a device from a group. More...
struct  APS_UnbindReq_t
 Parameters structure of the APS_UnbindReq_t() function. ZigBee spec r17: Table 2.8, page 38: APSME-UNBIND.request Parameters. The APSME-UNBIND.request primitive. This primitive allows the next higher layer to request to unbind two devices, or to unbind a device from a group, by removing an entry in its local binding table, if supported. More...

#define APS_MAX_DATA_FRAME_HEADER_LENGTH   12
 Max APS header size.
#define APS_MAX_DATA_FRAME_FOOTER_LENGTH   0
 Max APS footer size.
#define APS_MAX_ASDU_SIZE   (NWK_MAX_NSDU_SIZE - APS_MAX_DATA_FRAME_HEADER_LENGTH - APS_MAX_DATA_FRAME_FOOTER_LENGTH)
 Max size of APS payload.
#define APS_ASDU_OFFSET   (NWK_NSDU_OFFSET + APS_MAX_DATA_FRAME_HEADER_LENGTH)
 Size of the reserved header in the data frame.
#define APS_AFFIX_LENGTH   (APS_MAX_DATA_FRAME_HEADER_LENGTH + APS_MAX_DATA_FRAME_FOOTER_LENGTH + NWK_AFFIX_LENGTH)
 Size of the reserved part in the data frame.
#define APS_BROADCAST_ENDPOINT   0xff
 APS Broadcast Endpoint.
#define APS_MIN_USER_ENDPOINT   0x01
 Min user endpoint number.
#define APS_MAX_USER_ENDPOINT   0xf0
 Max user endpoint number.

Detailed Description

The header file describes the public APS interface and APS types.

Author:
Atmel Corporation: http://www.atmel.com
Support email: avr@atmel.com
Copyright (c) 2008 , Atmel Corporation. All rights reserved. Licensed under Atmel's Limited License Agreement (BitCloudTM).

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum APS_AddrMode_t

APS addressing modes.

Address mode is used in some of APS primitives

Defines APS addressing modes used in some standard primitives

Enumerator:
APS_NO_ADDRESS  Indirect addressing mode via binding future.
APS_GROUP_ADDRESS  Group addressing mode via multicast.
APS_SHORT_ADDRESS  Unicast addressing mode by 16-bit network address.
APS_EXT_ADDRESS  Unicast addressing mode by 64-bit IEEE address.

Definition at line 147 of file aps.h.

enum APS_Status_t

APS status values.

Status values in some of the APS primitives

APS status values used in the most part of standard primives except for the security service primitives where APS_SecurityStatus_t is used instead

Enumerator:
APS_SUCCESS_STATUS  SUCCESS.
APS_ASDU_TOO_LONG_STATUS  ASDU_TOO_LONG.
APS_DEFRAG_DEFERRED_STATUS  DEFRAG_DEFERRED.
APS_DEFRAG_UNSUPPORTED_STATUS  DEFRAG_UNSUPPORTED.
APS_ILLEGAL_REQUEST_STATUS  ILLEGAL_REQUEST.
APS_INVALID_BINDING_STATUS  INVALID_BINDING.
APS_INVALID_GROUP_STATUS  INVALID_GROUP.
APS_INVALID_PARAMETER_STATUS  INVALID_PARAMETER.
APS_NO_ACK_STATUS  NO_ACK.
APS_NO_BOUND_DEVICE_STATUS  NO_BOUND_DEVICE.
APS_NO_SHORT_ADDRESS_STATUS  NO_SHORT_ADDRESS.
APS_NOT_SUPPORTED_STATUS  NOT_SUPPORTED.
APS_SECURED_LINK_KEY_STATUS  SECURED_LINK_KEY.
APS_SECURED_NWK_KEY_STATUS  SECURED_NWK_KEY.
APS_SECURITY_FAIL_STATUS  SECURITY_FAIL.
APS_TABLE_FULL_STATUS  TABLE_FULL.
APS_UNSECURED_STATUS  UNSECURED.
APS_UNSUPPORTED_ATTRIBUTE_STATUS  UNSUPPORTED_ATTRIBUTE.
APS_NOT_INDICATED_STATUS  NOT_INDICATED (nonstandard status value).
APS_REQUEST_MEMORY_FULL_STATUS 

Definition at line 166 of file aps.h.

enum APS_SkkeStatus_t

APS SKKE status values.

Status values as result of SKKE protocol (APS Security)

APS SKKE status values used in APS Key Establishment mechanism

Enumerator:
APS_SKKE_SUCCESS_STATUS  SUCCESS.
APS_SKKE_INVALID_PARAMETER_STATUS  INVALID_PARAMETER.
APS_SKKE_NO_MASTER_KEY_STATUS  NO_MASTER_KEY.
APS_SKKE_INVALID_CHALLENGE_STATUS  INVALID_CHALLENGE.
APS_SKKE_INVALID_SKG_STATUS  INVALID_SKG.
APS_SKKE_INVALID_MAC_STATUS  INVALID_MAC.
APS_SKKE_INVALID_KEY_STATUS  INVALID_KEY.
APS_SKKE_TIMEOUT_STATUS  TIMEOUT.
APS_SKKE_BAD_FRAME_STATUS  BAD_FRAME.

Definition at line 201 of file aps.h.

enum APS_AibAttributeId_t

APS Information base attributes IDs.

AIB Attribute's ID definition

APS Information base attribute IDs used for AIB management with standard AIB maintenance primitives

Enumerator:
APS_AIB_BINDING_TABLE  apsBindingTable
APS_AIB_DESIGNATED_COORDINATOR  apsDesignatedCoordinator
APS_AIB_CHANNEL_MASK  apsChannelMask
APS_AIB_USE_EXTENDED_PANID  apsUseExtendedPANID

void APS_SetReq ( APS_SetReq_t *  req  ) 

Sets a parameter to AIB.

Function returns the result of transaction via callback call with confirm (APS_SetConf_t) primitive pointer as parameter

Parameters:
[in] req The APSME-SET.request (APS_SetReq_t) primitive pointer.
Returns:
None.

APS_RegisterEndpointReq_t* APS_GetEndpointList ( void   ) 

Returns the pointer to APS EndPointList.

Returns:
Valid APS EndpointList pointer or NULL if there are no registered endpoints.

void APS_StopEndpointIndication ( Endpoint_t  endpoint  ) 

Stops APS Data indications of specific endpoint number.

Parameters:
[in] endpoint The registered endpoint number. The 0xff special value means all registered endpoints.
Returns:
None.

void APS_ResumeEndpointIndication ( Endpoint_t  endpoint  ) 

Resumes APS Data indications of specific endpoint number.

Parameters:
[in] endpoint The registered endpoint number. The 0xff special value means all registered endpoints.
Returns:
None.

void APS_DataReq ( APS_DataReq_t *  req  ) 

Sends data to a node of a network.

Unicast, broadcast, or multicast data can be sent by this function. Function returns the result of transaction via callback call with confirm (APS_DataConf_t) primitive pointer as parameter.

Parameters:
[in] req The APSDE-DATA.request (APS_DataReq_t) primitive pointer.
Returns:
None.

void APS_AddGroupReq ( APS_AddGroupReq_t *  req  ) 

Adds a group to APS.

This function adds the current device to the members of certain group. Function returns the result of transaction via callback call with confirm (APS_AddGroupConf_t) primitive pointer as parameter.

Parameters:
[in] req The APSME-ADD-GROUP.request (APS_AddGroupReq_t) primitive pointer.
Returns:
None.

void APS_RemoveGroupReq ( APS_RemoveGroupReq_t *  req  ) 

Removes a group from APS.

This function removes the current device from the members of certain group. Function returns the result of transaction via callback call with confirm (APS_RemoveGroupConf_t) primitive pointer as parameter.

Parameters:
[in] req The APSME-REMOVE-GROUP.request (APS_RemoveGroupReq_t) primitive pointer.
Returns:
None.

void APS_RemoveAllGroupsReq ( APS_RemoveAllGroupsReq_t *  req  ) 

Removes all groups from APS.

This function removes the current device from members of all groups. Function returns the result of transaction via callback call with confirm (APS_RemoveAllGroupsConf_t) primitive pointer as parameter.

Parameters:
[in] req The APSME-REMOVE-ALL-GROUPS.request (APS_RemoveAllGroupsReq_t) primitive pointer.
Returns:
None.

bool APS_IsOwnGroup ( ShortAddr_t  addr  ) 

Check of an accessory to group.

Parameters:
[in] groupAddr - a group address.
Returns:
'true' if groupAddr is own group address or 'false' otherwise.
